meaning: incomparable knower of all the worlds
teacher of gods and men alike

(bhagga: pp. of bhañjati	break, break up, destroy)

perfect in observing all moral precepts
practised the highest stage of concentration

composition: (mahā+kilesa+nissaṭo: (pp. of nissarati) great+depravity+crushed, let loose, freed from)

meaning: crossed the great flood of sin
a foremost teacher of outstanding qualities

meaning: a radical destroyer of the strong stakes of craving

meaning: fully devoted in bringing highest welfare to the greatest number of people

showing result in this very life
